title: It’s Pi Day! A brief history to explain our obsession with 3.14
content:
Imagine a cup of tea. Wrap a piece of string around the circumference of the cup, and measure the length of the string. Then, lay your spoon on top of the cup, making sure it lies across the center of the cup, and measure the length from side to side – the diameter. Finally, divide the circumference by the diameter, and record the result. Next time you eat soup, repeat the process with the bowl. description: Pi (π) was introduced in 1706 to denote that constant ratio between the circumference of a circle to its diameter. But the fascination goes back millennia.
